sense.name: a state of halted activity, deactivation
sense.examples: There has been a work stoppage at the mill for two weeks while the new contract is being negotiated. The earthquake has resulted in a general stoppage of basic services to the community.

sense.name: a physical obstruction to a passage, blockage
sense.examples: This fluid is good for clearing out stoppages in your drains. The doctor suspects a stoppage in the patient's upper GI tract. Silt has effectively created a stoppage at the mouth of the river.

sense.name: an instance of halting some motion
sense.examples: The stoppage of the ball was achieved by a lineman who tackled the quarterback. The terrible noise was the stoppage of our rotary engine. The outfielder's stoppage of the ball prevented a home run.

sense.name: a knockout in boxing
sense.examples: The heavyweight's stoppage of his opponent occurred in just three rounds.
